title: Climate Change Basics
summary: What climate change is, greenhouse gases, and why it matters.

content.heading: What is climate change?
content.text: Climate change refers to long-term shifts in temperatures and weather patterns. It can be caused naturally and by human activities.
content.activity: List two local examples of weather changes you noticed.

content.heading: Greenhouse gases
content.text: Gases like CO2 and methane trap heat in the atmosphere, causing warming.
content.activity: Think of three sources of CO2 in daily life.

quiz.question: Which gas is the primary contributor to human-caused warming?
True or False: Climate change only refers to short-term weather events.

title: Causes & Effects of Global Warming
summary: Human and natural drivers, and impacts on people and ecosystems.

content.heading: Causes
content.text: Burning fossil fuels, deforestation, and intensive agriculture increase greenhouse gases.
content.activity: Identify a local example of deforestation.

content.heading: Effects
content.text: Sea level rise, stronger storms, heatwaves, and impacts on food supply.
content.activity: Describe a way local communities can adapt.

quiz.question: Which is a likely effect of global warming?

title: Mitigation & Adaptation
summary: Actions to reduce emissions (mitigation) and adjust to impacts (adaptation).

content.heading: Mitigation
content.text: Policies and technologies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions such as renewables and energy efficiency.
content.activity: List one action your household can take to mitigate emissions.

content.heading: Adaptation
content.text: Building resilience: flood defenses, early warning systems, and crop diversification.
content.activity: Think of a local adaptation measure.
